doc.field: Special Well Construction Areas - Twin Cities Metropolitan Area, Minnesota
Special Well Construction Areas - Twin Cities Metropolitan Area, Minnesota
Metropolitan Council Water Supply Planning Unit
Metropolitan Council Water Supply Planning Unit

This dataset provides information about Minnesota Department of Health designated Special Well Construction Areas located within the seven county Twin Cities metropolitan area, Minnesota. The data was collected through review of public documents provided online by the Minnesota Department of Health at http://www.health.state.mn.us/divs/eh/wells/swca/index.html. This dataset includes general information about the name of the Special Well Construction Area, the agency responsible for the area, some of the primary contaminants detected at the site, some general information about the distribution of certain contaminants, the county or counties affected by the management area, and the date that the area was mapped.

<?xml version="1.0"?><metadata><idinfo><citation><citeinfo><title>Special Well Construction Areas - Twin Cities Metropolitan Area, Minnesota</title><origin>Metropolitan Council</origin><pubinfo><publish>Metropolitan Council Water Supply Planning Unit</publish></pubinfo><pubdate>Unpublished material</pubdate><onlink>ftp://gisftp.metc.state.mn.us/SpecialWellConstructionAreas.zip</onlink></citeinfo></citation><descript><abstract>This dataset provides information about Minnesota Department of Health designated Special Well Construction Areas located within the seven county Twin Cities metropolitan area, Minnesota. The data was collected through review of public documents provided online by the Minnesota Department of Health at http://www.health.state.mn.us/divs/eh/wells/swca/index.html. This dataset includes general information about the name of the Special Well Construction Area, the agency responsible for the area, some of the primary contaminants detected at the site, some general information about the distribution of certain contaminants, the county or counties affected by the management area, and the date that the area was mapped.</abstract><purpose>The 2005 Minnesota Legislature directed the Metropolitan Council to "carry out planning activities addressing the water supply needs of the metropolitan area" (Minnesota Statutes, Section 473.1565). Specifically the Council is charged with developing a base of technical information for water supply planning decisions and to prepare a metropolitan area master water supply plan. This dataset supports this charge.</purpose><supplinf>Twin Cities Seven County Metropolitan Area. This includes the counties of Anoka, Carver, Dakota, Hennepin, Ramsey, Scott and Washington in Minnesota.</supplinf></descript><timeperd><timeinfo><sngdate><caldate>20090326</caldate></sngdate></timeinfo><current>Data is based upon the most recent information available from the Minnesota Department of Health.</current></timeperd><status><progress>In work</progress><update>As Needed</update></status><spdom><bounding><westbc>-479553.654667</westbc><eastbc>-518955.503402</eastbc><northbc>5024153.164604</northbc><southbc>4958033.688941</southbc></bounding></spdom><keywords><place><placekey>Twin Cities, Anoka County, Carver County, Dakota County, Hennepin County, Ramsey County, Scott County, Washington County</placekey></place><theme><themekey>water supply planning, Special Well Construction Area, contamination, Minnesota Department of Health</themekey></theme></keywords><accconst>None</accconst><useconst>By acceptance of this data, the user agrees to include a copy of the metadata record, including the liability disclaimer, whenever the user transmits or provides the GIS data (or any portion of it) to another user.</useconst><browse><browsen>None available</browsen><browsed /></browse><native>Microsoft Windows XP Version 5.1 (Build 2600) Service Pack 2; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.2.1.1332</native><ptcontac><cntinfo><cntperp><cntorg>Metropolitan Council</cntorg><cntper>Lanya Ross</cntper></cntperp><cntpos>Sr. Environmental Scientist, Water Supply Planning</cntpos><cntaddr><address>390 Robert St. North</address><city>St Paul</city><state>MN</state><postal>55101-1805</postal></cntaddr><cntvoice>651-602-1803</cntvoice><cntfax>651-602-1130</cntfax><cntemail>lanya.ross@metc.state.mn.us</cntemail></cntinfo></ptcontac></idinfo><dataqual><attracc><attraccr>This accuracy of this dataset is based on data availability. The Minnesota Department of Health should be contacted for more information if specific water resource management decisions need to be made.</attraccr></attracc><lineage><procstep><procdesc>Shapefile polygons were delineated by hand based on maps published in various online reports provided by the Minnesota Department of Health at http://www.health.state.mn.us/divs/eh/wells/swca/index.htm.</procdesc></procstep><srcinfo><srcscale /></srcinfo><procstep><procdesc Sync="TRUE">Dataset copied.</procdesc><srcused Sync="TRUE">N:\EQA\WaterSupply\MAPS_Make_A_Map\MAM_WaterSupply_2Mar09\MAM_WatSUp_Metadata_23Apr09\SWCAs</srcused><procdate Sync="TRUE">20091208</procdate><proctime Sync="TRUE">10043000</proctime></procstep></lineage></dataqual><spdoinfo><indspref /><direct>Vector</direct><mgmg3obj /><mgmg3til /></spdoinfo><eainfo><overview><eaover>Name - Minnesota Department of Health name of Special Well Construction, or Well Advisory, Area
Agency_Res - Agency responsible for delineating and/or managing the Special Well Construction Area
Contaminan - One or more of the primary contaminants detected at the site. This is not a complete list, and users are encouraged to review Minnesota Department of Health or other documents for more information.
Notes - Generalized description of the aquifers and/or areas impacted by contamination. This is not a complete list, and users are encouraged to review Minnesota Department of Health or other documents for more information.
County - County or counties overlapping the Special Well Construction Area
DateMapped - Year that the Special Well Construction Area was designated</eaover></overview></eainfo><distinfo><distliab>NOTICE: The Geographic Information System (GIS) Data to which this notice is attached are made available pursuant to the Minnesota Government Data Practices Act (Minnesota Statutes Chapter 13).
